div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1875 Volterra, Etruria, 1868 (1166) Burial: c. 500 B.C. (K) Contents: 65 AR Fractions of Auriol type Fpt. Pegasus: 26 Gorgoneion: 16 Seal hd.: 5 Goat hd.: 2 Facing hd.: 2 Eagle hd.: 1 Female hd.: 2 Helmet: 4 Octopus: 1 Unc.: 3 Blank: 3 Disposition: Florence 4 Gamurrini, PerNumSfrag 1872, p. 208; 1874, pp. 54-7, illus. Jameson 17, a gold coin as Sambon 2, is said to have come from this find, as is Weber 70 (later SNGLloyd 26), an example of Sambon 79. Both coins could have come from the Cecina 1858 hd., no. 1954 below
